name: Hope & Justice- SPCA CT
description: When we visited the Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals of Connecticut to donate the money BARK! had raised over the course of the month, I met two abuse survivors, Hope and Justice, who were literally dumped on the SPCA's doorstep not too long ago. They've recovered considerably since then, but it'll take 6-12 months and an estimated $5000 in medical bills before they've healed completely. BARK! has taken on these two as ambassadors, meaning 100% of the profits from their designs will be going toward that treatment, so please considering buying or donating on their behalf! To find out more about the dogs represented in this set, check out the Meet the Dogs tab; pictures and info coming soon!

name: I Support Second Chances shirt- SHIBA [coming soon]
description: The Shiba Inu edition of the I support second chances t-shirt. 100% of profits from this line will be put toward the everyday expenses at the shelter. Being able to feed and house more dogs for longer periods of time will eliminate last resort tactics like euthanasia- and this money will be used not only to save dogs, but also to improve the overall quality of their lives at the shelter. More colors and breeds available soon!

name: Buttons- SHIBA
description: An affordable way to show your support! Pins are $2 each or three for $5. As with all BARK! products, 100% of profits will go towards our shelter affiliates, saving dogs from euthanasia. In this case, the shelter receiving the profits is the SPCA of Connecticut, a humane no kill shelter- but due to economic strain, 29 of their dogs are now in danger of being put down, and every dollar counts. Profits from the I Support Second Chances and I Gave a Dog a Voice pins will cover everyday shelter expenses, while profits from the I Helped a Dog Heal pin will be used to help pay medical bills for those dogs who require special treatment.

options.name: I Gave A Dog A Voice

name: Adoption Prep- ELLINGTON [retired]
description: EDIT: Freckles has officially been adopted! Because he's successfully found a home, this pin will now be retired; if you'd like to read about how his life has been turned around, check out the Success Stories tab. Congratulations to Freckles, and thank you to everyone who's helped him come this far! -- As a promotional product in honor of National Be Kind To Animals Week (the first full week of May each year), BARK! is currently selling the Adoption Prep pin to support Ellington Animal Control. EAC is a shelter whose staff works hard every day to provide for their dogs, but recent budget cuts by the town have left them struggling. 100% of profits from this pin will be put toward the funds necessary to keep EAC up and running and, as the button suggests, help prepare its wonderful dogs for adoption and a better life. To find out more about the dog represented in this pin, check out the Meet the Dogs tab.

name: I Helped A Dog Heal shirt- SHIBA [coming soon]
description: The Shiba Inu edition of the I helped a dog heal t-shirt. 100% of profits from this line will be put towards the medical expenses of diseased, disabled or otherwise impaired dogs. These are lovable dogs who have been unable to find forever homes due to their poor health, so this merchandise is BARK!'s way of giving them a chance to turn their lives around. More colors and breeds available soon!
